title: Rise in Non-Covid-19 Deaths Hits Life Insurers
sub_head: Companies believe lack of medical treatment during pandemic has contributed to deaths from other causes
body:
U.S. life insurers, as expected, made a large number of Covid-19 death-benefit payouts last year. More surprisingly, many saw a jump in other death claims, too.
Industry executives and actuaries believe many of these other fatalities are tied to delays in medical care as a result of lockdowns in 2020, and then, later, peopleâ€™s fears of seeking out treatment and trouble lining up appointments.
